reviewText: Ice T really goes into every aspect of the Pimp game in between scenes.  Actually a very entertaining DVD. Coco even makes a little appearance, but pay close attention you might miss her.

C'mon folks, how can anyone not think that Ice T rocks hard? Sarah, I'm in total support of SVU but saying that Ice T is commical and silly is blasphemy.  And I realize that writting this could also me construed as commical and silly since Sarah will never read this and since I didn't ever watch the movie. In fact I'm betting that with a little luck some administrator of the Amazon website will stuble on this and decide it needs a good deleting.  Unless theres's some kind of preposting review process that i know nothing about, in which case this'll never hit the site to begin with.

Alright, back on topic.  Ice T is a  savage, who else could pull off punching his fist into the palm of his other hand, scrunching up his face, and looking at the camera menacingly?

So with Ice T being this cool, Sarah, don't you think that maybe we could all learn a little something from him?  Like maybe pimpin' 101?  I'm betting that if you had watched that video with serious interest rather than just for comedic value, you might already have at least 3 hoes working under you.  And then, after your arm gets tired from slappin' the silly hoes, you could take all the money and buy stuff off amazon (check it out admin. i'm supporting your site, that's a good reason not to yank this review right off of it).

Thanks to my obsession with Law & Order: SVU I've become quite a fan of Ice-T.  His hilariously awful acting skills and lame one-liners make the show very enjoyable, which is why I thought his guide to pimping could only be funnier.

This is entirely true - although the DVD wasn't exactly what I expected. It's very, very pornographic.  That aside, it is hilarious.  I've never seen such low-quality, low-budget porn. Ice's garish pimp suits, cheap sluts, and explaination of each type of ho are so comical it's hard to imagine that even he takes himself seriously.  The "live musical performance by Ice T" is a home video of him rapping at a party while wasted.
